name: UK Soccer Mix Quiz | Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which club employed the three top paid players in the world in 2003?
questions.explanation:
Real Madrid.

	Real Madrid has won the Champions League many times, and has also had some great players including Raul Ronaldo and Zidane. They also broke the world record transfer fee in July 2009 when Cristiano Ronaldo moved to Real from  Manchester United.

questions.text: Who said one of his favorite childhood memories was frightening away fans in Manchester City's Kippax stand?
questions.explanation:
Noel Gallagher.

	Noel Gallagher is the lead guitarist in the band Oasis.

questions.text: Which league club had the first female General Manager?
questions.explanation:
Reading.

	Annie Bassett was the first-ever General Manager for an English team, when she was appointed to Reading AFC in 1988.

questions.text: Which World Cup hero did Matt Busby call, "As near to perfection as man and player as it is possible to be"?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Charlton.

	Bobby Charlton was a player under Matt Busby during the Munich air crash that killed seven Manchester United players in 1958.

questions.text: Which League Two club sank to the conference after they finshed 2nd last in the 2002-03 season, even with Uri Geller on its board, and Michael Jackson as an honorary director?
questions.explanation:
Exeter City.

	Exeter City's home ground has the same name as Newcastle nNited's home ground: St. James Park (they are not the same stadium).

questions.text: Which clubs blue and claret shirt was emblazoned with the words 'Dagenham Motors' from 1993 to 1997?
questions.explanation:
West Ham United.

	West Ham United was managed by Harry Redknapp from 1994 to 2001. Former Chelsea legend Gianfranco Zola, was appointed manager in 2008.

questions.text: In which Uruguayan city was Centenario stadium built to host the first World Cup in 1930?
questions.explanation:
Montevideo.

	Uruguay was the first-ever team to win the World Cup in 1930, defeating Argentina 4-2.  The United States finished third.

questions.text: Which goalkeeper was reportedly the bargain of the season when he went to Manchester City in 2004?
questions.explanation:
David James.

	David James played for Liverpool in 1992.  He made his debut with Aston Villa in 1999.  David signed with Manchester City in January 2004 to replace the retired David Seaman.  He later played for Portsmouth in 2006.

questions.text: Why was 16 yards of tape required in early soccer matches?
options: To show where the throw-in line was
To show the start of the box
questions.explanation:
To serve as a crossbar.

	Wood with a light metal wrap was later used to make the crossbar.

questions.text: What colour was the ball when England beat West Germany 4-2 at in the 1966 World Cup final?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	The leagues later changed to a white ball with the colour of their home kit striped around them.
